page.title: 05BOXFORD CHURCH
page.content:
Boxford Church is 500 years old and some of the church is cracking and falling down so there is scaffolding around the church because it is being restored.
There are new windows being put in. They are putting new stone around the windows. It costs 1,500 pounds to repair a window.
The oldest grave was made in 1590 so it is nearly 400 years old. There are two sundials on top of the church. There are nine doors and a trap door on the roof. On average there are three marriages each year, ten christenings, eight or ten burials. There is a Holy Communion at 8.00 a.m. and a service at 10.30 a.m. for morning prayer every Sunday.
